alert.note: Alert for Benton; Henry; Houston; Humphreys; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 4:37PM CDT until April 23 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Johnsonville Tennessee River at Perryville Tennessee River at Savannah ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Johnsonville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 360.0 feet, Low-lying and agricultural areas along the river from the Interstate 40 bridge to Land Between the Lakes, including boat launches, access points, and portions of the Tennessee River National Wildlife Refuge near the Duck River begin to inundate. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 360.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 360.5 feet on Tuesday. It will then fall to 360 feet by Thursday evening. The river will continue to fall. - Action stage is 360.0 feet. - Flood stage is 361.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
